pages.page:
In the world, many cities in many countries have landmark build- ings and these buildings contain artistic elements.
For example, the Eiﬀel Tower in
France is one of the landmarks in the city of Paris and a technical
masterpiece in the history of archi- tecture. Its structure uses 7,300
metric tons of wrought iron and the
total including non-metallic parts is about 10,000 metric tons.
Another example is Singa-
pore’s Changi Airport. It is
also one of Singapore’s land-
marks, especially the T5
Starry Rain at the center of
Changi is the highest indoor
waterfall in the world, and it
is also an artwork in archite-
cture.

Next, Taiwan's high-heeled church is a large-scale installation art landscap-
ing located in Seaview Park, Budai Town, Chiayi County, Taiwan. The appear-
ance is blue transparent glass high-heeled shoes, the main structure is about
17 meters high, 11 meters long, with 1269 steel frame and 320 pieces of glass
are assembled together. The size and assembly angle of each piece of glass are
diﬀerent. The total engineering cost is NT $ 23.17 million. It is an artistic mas-
terpiece of modern architecture.
Finally, the landmark buildings in every city in the world have
diﬀerent appearances and art attracting more people to visit and
driving the local economic development.
0511304王基雄
